title: spec: Declaring variable in global scope
body:
While declaring a new variable in global scope we have to use the following syntax:

var dummy string =  "test string"

However, this following syntax doesn't work:

dummy := "test string"

It works fine in a functions scope, is there any particular reason for this? 
go version go1.4.2 darwin/amd64

PS: Not sure where to ask this question, so asking at this place.
